db_api: add multi sort interface into db api

Add an interface to get all flavors that match all filters sorted
by multiple keys.

Change-Id: Ic6ecd378460ddc12a77e56ecc1938249866d5631
Implements: blueprint multi-sort-keys-and-directions-support

commit_message:
Add exception catch to image detail API

When the image service is erred, under certain situations
glanceclient may raise a httpinternalerror exception. This 500
exception is not properly handled by nova api. This patch enables
the api to handle this exception properly.

Change-Id: I339b2f02a4119aef01685206fef827e1f67de202
Closes-Bug: #1529533

commit_message:
scheduler: do not update HostState if compute_node has no valid data

If a compute node is created in db but never updated with useful
data by nova-compute, HostState update should be skipped.

Change-Id: I44f15c7f80a2dcd37c81e2dc099c9ee1a3593f5f
Closes-Bug: #1515870

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-29 12:58:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/filters.py', 'nova/conf/scheduler.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_weights.py', 'nova/weights.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': 'WIP: prototype filter based scheduler weights

Use filters to generate the list of filter weights. This uses an ordered
list of filters to create a bit field that gives you the list of host
weights.

This also uses the existing weighers system, normalises the output
between 0 and 1, then adds that to the score from the above system.
This is designed purely as a transition method, while all existing
weighers get converted to the filter system. Note filter based weights
always win out any older weighers.

Introduces the new configuration scheduler_soft_filters that allows
users to set the list of filters that should be used for weights.

This relates to the following backlog spec:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/256323/6/specs/backlog/approved/ordered-filter-scheduler.rst

Change-Id: I4d8ee9f790b5816144e4a6c1b30511977c24d506
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: prototype filter based scheduler weights

Use filters to generate the list of filter weights. This uses an ordered
list of filters to create a bit field that gives you the list of host
weights.

This also uses the existing weighers system, normalises the output
between 0 and 1, then adds that to the score from the above system.
This is designed purely as a transition method, while all existing
weighers get converted to the filter system. Note filter based weights
always win out any older weighers.

Introduces the new configuration scheduler_soft_filters that allows
users to set the list of filters that should be used for weights.

This relates to the following backlog spec:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/256323/6/specs/backlog/approved/ordered-filter-scheduler.rst

Change-Id: I4d8ee9f790b5816144e4a6c1b30511977c24d506

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-29 11:18:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': 'Sync up instance object with nova db before unshelve operation done.

When unshelve instance, the instance object not sync up with nova db:
1. During unshelving, user(3rd party software) may want store some information
in instance system metadata, but after unshelve operation done,
those information will be overwrite because conductor code will save
original instance object to nova db;
2. When create new instance, the conductor code will refresh instance object;
The unshelve operation need do same thing to ensure the instance object keep consistent with nova db.

Change-Id: I5026b5336451366041f28144f1df32298d3b3e89
Closes-Bug: #1548209
'}]
commit_message:
Sync up instance object with nova db before unshelve operation done.

When unshelve instance, the instance object not sync up with nova db:
1. During unshelving, user(3rd party software) may want store some information
in instance system metadata, but after unshelve operation done,
those information will be overwrite because conductor code will save
original instance object to nova db;
2. When create new instance, the conductor code will refresh instance object;
The unshelve operation need do same thing to ensure the instance object keep consistent with nova db.

Change-Id: I5026b5336451366041f28144f1df32298d3b3e89
Closes-Bug: #1548209

commit_message:
Creates disk.fallocate_test

Test of fallocate fails if test file does not exist
prior to running fallocate test. fallocate test file
needs to be created prior to testing fallocate.

Change-Id: Id43abc814d29e059e6cd8da70719c54b8e15d6dc

commit_message:
Don't ignore failure to load extensions

When an extension fails to load a message will be logged along with
the exception raised by the extension. The exception will be
re-raised.

Change-Id: Ic8e8931a34f59102dbcd1f5c5dc48d562cabedff
Closes-bug: #1555005

subject: Do not use --timeout for the upgrade init command
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-24 11:25:44.000000000', 'files': ['environments/major-upgrade-pacemaker-init.yaml'], 'message': "Do not use --timeout for the upgrade init command

os-refresh-config doesn't have the --timeout option in
Mitaka. So when upgrading from Mitaka to Newton, the
init step try to use os-refresh-config with --timeout 1444
We need to avoid this, before the package has been updated

Change-Id: I0fddee3f6bd103dc01569e68bd1e6ed085d2e3df
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use --timeout for the upgrade init command

os-refresh-config doesn't have the --timeout option in
Mitaka. So when upgrading from Mitaka to Newton, the
init step try to use os-refresh-config with --timeout 1444
We need to avoid this, before the package has been updated

Change-Id: I0fddee3f6bd103dc01569e68bd1e6ed085d2e3df

commit_message:
Add new test for fuelweb 'Hard reset of primary controller for Neutron'

        Scenario:
        1. Deploy environment with 3 controllers and NeutronTUN or NeutronVLAN,
           all default storages, 2 compute, 1 cinder node
        2. Verify networks
        3. Run OSTF tests
        4. Hard reset of primary controller
        5. Wait for HA services to be ready
        6. Wait for for OS services to be ready
        7. Verify networks
        8. Run OSTF tests

        Duration 100m
        Snapshot deploy_reset_primary_neutron

Related blueprint run-fuel-qa-on-baremetal

Change-Id: I350dabfaf7873e67dd921fe537c66bb6e1e9a7a6

subject: Enhance help message of upload_to_image
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-25 10:02:32.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v3/shell.py', 'cinderclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': 'Enhance help message of upload_to_image

Following the commit fb2c434c2461a25193067104de766fc1142a6024 in
the cinder repo the --force option to upload-to-image is ignored
by default. To enable it the config option enable_force_upload
must be set to true.

The help text for upload-to-image in the python cinderclient
should remind user that --force may not work in some cloud now.

Closes-Bug: #1611667
Change-Id: Ib56fb2016d933a9bbbcb0185c50e33d2166b34e6
'}]
commit_message:
Enhance help message of upload_to_image

Following the commit fb2c434c2461a25193067104de766fc1142a6024 in
the cinder repo the --force option to upload-to-image is ignored
by default. To enable it the config option enable_force_upload
must be set to true.

The help text for upload-to-image in the python cinderclient
should remind user that --force may not work in some cloud now.

Closes-Bug: #1611667
Change-Id: Ib56fb2016d933a9bbbcb0185c50e33d2166b34e6

commit_message:
Configure keystone authtoken options

Add ironic api and inspector authtoken classes to
configure keystone authtoken related parameters.
Unit tests are updated accordingly.

Deprecate some parameters in api and inspectore classes:
  - ironic::api|inspector::admin_tenant_name is deprecated
    in favor of ironic::api|inspector::authtoken::project_name.
  - ironic::api|inspector::admin_user is deprecated
    in favor of ironic::api|inspector::authtoken::username.
  - ironic::api|inspector::admin_password is deprecated
    in favor of ironic::api|inspector::authtoken::password.
  - ironic::api|inspector::identity_uri is deprecated
    in favor of ironic::api|inspector::authtoken::auth_uri.
  - ironic::api|inspector::auth_uri is deprecated
    in favor of ironic::api|inspector::authtoken::auth_uri.
  - ironic::api::memcached_servers is deprecated
    in favor of ironic::api::authtoken::memcached_servers.

Closes-bug: #1604463

Change-Id: Idcb9557ab0b42b2a0dba7cf2ab6a5ccf52dd1d23

commit_message:
Permit usage of raw disks as backends for Swift storage

Adds a SwiftRawDisks parameter which can be used to provide a map
disk-keyed with properties for each additional disk to be used
as backend for Swift storage.

commit_message:
Xstatic packages are published to pypi.

The Xstatic packages are published to pypi but are missing
include-pypi-link from the yaml file.  This was noticed as the recent
releases of xstatic-angular-smart-table did not generate the
'new-release' upper-constraints.txt updates.

Fix that.

Change-Id: I50133387a15f47016f6e67957aee48f752a62ec8

In Newton, there is no longer a way to test LBaaS v1 commands.

subject: get_endpoint should return None when no version found
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-25 03:51:59.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/identity/base.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/identity/test_identity_common.py'], 'message': 'get_endpoint should return None when no version found

After patch Ia08538ccf00c9063dc0d284c5ece9a969c15500a the urljoin would
ensure that a URL was always returned from the get_endpoint method even
when the version was not available. This breaks plugin discovery and a
number of other areas.

Change-Id: I04014b6e770c2e9708c5f9c81c3160d51603ad0c
Closes-Bug: #1616720
'}]
commit_message:
get_endpoint should return None when no version found

After patch Ia08538ccf00c9063dc0d284c5ece9a969c15500a the urljoin would
ensure that a URL was always returned from the get_endpoint method even
when the version was not available. This breaks plugin discovery and a
number of other areas.

Change-Id: I04014b6e770c2e9708c5f9c81c3160d51603ad0c
Closes-Bug: #1616720

commit_message:
Add os-testr test requirement for neutron-lib job

Add os-testr to the test requirements since it is needed for the
periodic-networking-ovn-py34-with-neutron-lib-master job. The job
uses the tools/ostestr_compat_shim.sh script which uses the ostestr
utility.

subject: Modify the SQL's string from double quote to single quote.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-22 14:21:51.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/node_cache.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-crash-when-use-postgresql-ac6c708f48f55c83.yaml'], 'message': "Modify the SQL's string from double quote to single quote.

Using double quotes for strings does not conform to the ANSI standard.
While MySQL accepts it, PostgreSQL raises an error.

This patch fixes crash when used with PostgreSQL.

Closes-Bug: #1606534
Change-Id: Id979043b1573bf2ea473e772c7ea7417c733d753
(cherry picked from commit 6ba331aad227ac9a08c746d624d78e25d0267177)
"}]
commit_message:
Modify the SQL's string from double quote to single quote.

Using double quotes for strings does not conform to the ANSI standard.
While MySQL accepts it, PostgreSQL raises an error.

This patch fixes crash when used with PostgreSQL.

Closes-Bug: #1606534
Change-Id: Id979043b1573bf2ea473e772c7ea7417c733d753
(cherry picked from commit 6ba331aad227ac9a08c746d624d78e25d0267177)

commit_message:
Disable all hiera override yamls for globals

We need to ensure that globals uses only astute.yaml to generate its
helper variables. Othewise, we will have an issue on the second
deployment if we modify astute.yaml and re-run the deployment

Relates to I91ab492b44c137c476722f65de3dd99b2dce988a

Change-Id: Ieef42f063911ed05ce05f1411bbaa1d4867aa455
Related-Bug: #1590375
Closes-bug: #1598163

commit_message:
Update dnsmasq for additional networks

This change includes an updated listen-address configuration for the
additional admin networks that can be configured.  This change looks
through the puppet facts to try and identify which interface is
configured for the extra admin network and uses the ip address that
exists in the admin network cidr as a listen-address for dnsmasq

Change-Id: I3322b4e945d3bd016a2c1977dc89c2227735b2e8
Closes-Bug: #1606914

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Instead of assertTrue and assertFalse use more specific asserts.
They are compatible with Python 2.7[1] and 3.4[2]

[1]: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html
[2]: https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I4ceeca372e365ebaf9202fc21e53e4ade1372d9f

subject: [Urgent] mock _allocate_ips_for_port in unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-25 08:12:18.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_plugin.py'], 'message': "[Urgent] mock _allocate_ips_for_port in unit tests

1. What is the problem
To simulate Neutron database operations in unit tests, FakeQuery and
FakeSession are defined to replace the original Query and Session
objects. After service subnets feature is merged into Neutron[1], during
ip allocation, Neutron calls Query.add_entity to query subnet by service
type. However, FakeQuery object doesn't have add_entity method, thus
unit tests fail to pass.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Mock _allocate_ips_for_port to bypass the service subnet query, which
is not necessary in the unit tests.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
No new feature introduced.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/350613/

Change-Id: Ieec7f5ab7b63cba0b1c9569e87dd894dd34b07c2
"}]
commit_message:
[Urgent] mock _allocate_ips_for_port in unit tests

1. What is the problem
To simulate Neutron database operations in unit tests, FakeQuery and
FakeSession are defined to replace the original Query and Session
objects. After service subnets feature is merged into Neutron[1], during
ip allocation, Neutron calls Query.add_entity to query subnet by service
type. However, FakeQuery object doesn't have add_entity method, thus
unit tests fail to pass.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Mock _allocate_ips_for_port to bypass the service subnet query, which
is not necessary in the unit tests.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
No new feature introduced.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/350613/

Change-Id: Ieec7f5ab7b63cba0b1c9569e87dd894dd34b07c2

subject: Fix recordset changes so that they preserve object changes fields
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-18 16:48:20.000000000', 'files': ['designate/objects/adapters/api_v2/recordset.py', 'designate/tests/unit/test_objects/test_recordset.py'], 'message': "Fix recordset changes so that they preserve object changes fields

- Previous to this patch, the multiple actions on `recordset.records`
was causing the changes fields to lose changes.
- This is attempt 2 at fixing this, as https://review.openstack.org/#/c/348534/
went and broke the whole world

Here's a log of the unit tests failing on master:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/543432/

Change-Id: I97e548e59487a36fff1357187d0cf7fb29f31f37
"}]
commit_message:
Fix recordset changes so that they preserve object changes fields

- Previous to this patch, the multiple actions on `recordset.records`
was causing the changes fields to lose changes.
- This is attempt 2 at fixing this, as https://review.openstack.org/#/c/348534/
went and broke the whole world

Here's a log of the unit tests failing on master:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/543432/

Change-Id: I97e548e59487a36fff1357187d0cf7fb29f31f37

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-22 00:20:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_client.py', 'nova/scheduler/client/report.py'], 'message': 'rt: remove ComputeNode.create_inventory

The ComputeNode.update_inventory() and ComputeNode.create_inventory()
were writing changes to the inventories table in the API database (or
possibly even the cell database depending on whether the deployment was
Mitaka or Newton milestone-2.

This code path is no longer desired, and since no code is the scheduler
currently *reads* the inventory information via the ComputeNode object,
we can safely get rid of the call to ComputeNode.create_inventory() that
were being made in the scheduler reporting client.

Change-Id: Ia10036a8c2e9b1e40cf5674584ce468f892b8f97
blueprint: generic-resource-pools
blueprint: compute-node-inventory-newton
'}]
commit_message:
rt: remove ComputeNode.create_inventory

The ComputeNode.update_inventory() and ComputeNode.create_inventory()
were writing changes to the inventories table in the API database (or
possibly even the cell database depending on whether the deployment was
Mitaka or Newton milestone-2.

This code path is no longer desired, and since no code is the scheduler
currently *reads* the inventory information via the ComputeNode object,
we can safely get rid of the call to ComputeNode.create_inventory() that
were being made in the scheduler reporting client.

Change-Id: Ia10036a8c2e9b1e40cf5674584ce468f892b8f97
blueprint: generic-resource-pools
blueprint: compute-node-inventory-newton

subject: Add oslopolicy script runs to the docs tox target
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-24 21:00:35.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Add oslopolicy script runs to the docs tox target

In an untouched codebase these two commands should not output anything
of interest as they are primarily tools for managing a custom
policy.json file. But it's useful to run them to ensure that they do not
error out.

Change-Id: I33e0b27164a0e9df240337c7e9b467f0f3859eac
"}]
commit_message:
Add oslopolicy script runs to the docs tox target

In an untouched codebase these two commands should not output anything
of interest as they are primarily tools for managing a custom
policy.json file. But it's useful to run them to ensure that they do not
error out.

Change-Id: I33e0b27164a0e9df240337c7e9b467f0f3859eac

commit_message:
Add checkers_infra for check various environment settings

Quick implementation of the first infra checker.

- check if network filters enabled for bridges.
  It is not checked for all test cases by default, because some
  test cases require different settings.

Change-Id: Ic76337c850b1ed9f1d039627561b3e27a4d7172f
Related-Bug:#1497960

commit_message:
Fix logging of dsl executor

Previously, logger didn't support both unicode
and str at the same time. It caused to error
during attempt to log the content of binary file

Change-Id: I15f109298672c35bdddd659206b4e1a5682379d9
Closes-Bug: #1561522

commit_message:
Use osc-lib instead of openstackclient

osc-lib is a package of common support modules for writing
OSC plugins. All common functions, classes such as exceptions,
utils, logs and so on have been moved from openstackclient to
osc-lib. So use osc-lib instead of openstackclient.

Since osc-lib 1.0.2 has released, it is stable to use.

Change-Id: Ia1569eeb7b52d3b5c0b1dd8312f397e7c7c3f869

commit_message:
Use osc_lib instead of cliff

Base classes of commands are defined in cliff,
but have been encapsulated again in osc-lib for
all plugin clients. So use osc-lib instead of
cliff.

Since osc-lib 1.0.2 has released, it is stable
to use.

Change-Id: I0b9bf1c867be0181d573decadc840a887a784ca9

subject: DOC - note that stable/mitaka on Ubuntu works at most with 14.04
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-25 08:05:51.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer-docs/quickstart-aio.rst'], 'message': 'DOC - note that stable/mitaka on Ubuntu works at most with 14.04

openstack-ansible-aio doesn't work on Ubuntu 16.04. The error message
when executing `# scripts/run-playbooks.sh` will look like this:

    TASK: [lxc_hosts | Gather variables for each operating system]
    failed: [aio1] => {"failed": true, "item": null}
    msg: No source file given

    FATAL: all hosts have already failed -- aborting

There was an IRC discussion which stated the upper version the
stable/mitaka release supports for Ubuntu:
    http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ansible/
    %23openstack-ansible.2016-05-16.log.html#t2016-05-16T18:48:13

This change updates the docs to make that relationship clear.

Change-Id: Ia9060ebce6ca568f06e14b964700800d0ea8a6b1
'}]
commit_message:
DOC - note that stable/mitaka on Ubuntu works at most with 14.04

openstack-ansible-aio doesn't work on Ubuntu 16.04. The error message
when executing `# scripts/run-playbooks.sh` will look like this:

    TASK: [lxc_hosts | Gather variables for each operating system]
    failed: [aio1] => {"failed": true, "item": null}
    msg: No source file given

    FATAL: all hosts have already failed -- aborting

There was an IRC discussion which stated the upper version the
stable/mitaka release supports for Ubuntu:
    http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ansible/
    %23openstack-ansible.2016-05-16.log.html#t2016-05-16T18:48:13

This change updates the docs to make that relationship clear.

Change-Id: Ia9060ebce6ca568f06e14b964700800d0ea8a6b1

This does not support comma_delimited_lists and is
implemented by using parameter schema in the subsequent
patches.

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-08-17 06:34:09.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/tripleo-sriov.rst'], 'message': 'tripleo-sriov

This spec file covers the specifications to add SR-IOV functionality
in tripleo.

SR-IOV extends the PCI Express specification and allows a PCIe device
to appear to be multiple separate physical PCIe devices. SR-IOV
provides one or more Virtual Functions (VFs) and a Physical
Function(PF).  These VF’s could be attached to VMs like a dedicated
PCIe device, which boosts the networking performance considerably.

This feature is supported in OpenStack, but the setup and
configuration part is manual and it is not supported in TripleO.

Co-Authored-By: Karthik Sundaravel <ksundara@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I9f336a0c80575558575c85b6628954d3c8422610
'}]
commit_message:
tripleo-sriov

This spec file covers the specifications to add SR-IOV functionality
in tripleo.

SR-IOV extends the PCI Express specification and allows a PCIe device
to appear to be multiple separate physical PCIe devices. SR-IOV
provides one or more Virtual Functions (VFs) and a Physical
Function(PF).  These VF’s could be attached to VMs like a dedicated
PCIe device, which boosts the networking performance considerably.

This feature is supported in OpenStack, but the setup and
configuration part is manual and it is not supported in TripleO.

Co-Authored-By: Karthik Sundaravel <ksundara@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I9f336a0c80575558575c85b6628954d3c8422610

commit_message:
Trust the roles to specify the correct inventory group

The script was previously trying to determine the group
based on the name of the role, but we already have the role name
to group mapping in the data provided by the py_pkgs lookup

Change-Id: Ife1c81f21f67f4d643d60fa5d6061e4f3a7dad0a

commit_message:
Remove deprecated security_group_api config option

The security_group_api config option was deprecated in version 13.0.0
and functionality was replaced by a 'use_neutron' configuration
option. Uses of the deprecated security_group_api option have been
updated to 'use_neutron' for a more coherent user experience.

Co-Authored-By: Sarah Ulmer <Sarah.Ulmer@ibm.com>

Change-Id: I921650d8730201c2f14deb7e679647a892dbe48a

The ansible.cfg file has been removed to allow a deployer to specify their
own configurations without having to modify the ansible.cfg file within the
playbooks directory.

subject: Fix issue "SDKException: Connection failure that may be retried."
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-24 16:00:06.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/session.py'], 'message': 'Fix issue "SDKException: Connection failure that may be retried."

This issue will happen when your cloud service endpoints are in
  https and you are using openstack client to perform some
actions related to neutron service.

This issue happened in openstacksdk-0.9.2 and higher.

This issue is because something not expected when finding
  a suitable version of Neutron service endpoint. You will
find you will get an endpoint which is http instead of https.

Closes-Bug: #1616522
Change-Id: Iefb1c8dea7a91fdac56ba86bd8af7dcf0f268acd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issue "SDKException: Connection failure that may be retried."

This issue will happen when your cloud service endpoints are in
  https and you are using openstack client to perform some
actions related to neutron service.

This issue happened in openstacksdk-0.9.2 and higher.

This issue is because something not expected when finding
  a suitable version of Neutron service endpoint. You will
find you will get an endpoint which is http instead of https.

Closes-Bug: #1616522
Change-Id: Iefb1c8dea7a91fdac56ba86bd8af7dcf0f268acd

commit_message:
Add specified OSTF runner into upgrade tests

Sometimes OSTF tests fail with non-related
cluster health and upgrade reasons. For
stabilization of upgrade tests we need to
ignore these failures.

Change-Id: Ib0f6f58576dd71b5556a7685623abe2a68f6a456

To filter the table contents, many tables are defining filterAction.
However, in almost cases,  filter_type is 'query'.
In this case, the performance of filter is done by client side (maybe below).
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.tables.js#L535
Therefore, some codes seems not to be executed. This patch will delete it.

Change-Id: I375652a697f68e1f575546f3c0381bd71dd3dd15
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor some places using filterAction with using filter_type as 'query'

To filter the table contents, many tables are defining filterAction.
However, in almost cases,  filter_type is 'query'.
In this case, the performance of filter is done by client side (maybe below).
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.tables.js#L535
Therefore, some codes seems not to be executed. This patch will delete it.

Change-Id: I375652a697f68e1f575546f3c0381bd71dd3dd15

If ML2 is not in use, CONF.ml2.mechanism_drivers is not a registered
option and thus loading these drivers leads to a NoSuchOptError error.
This patch ensures that the exception is handled and the loading state
of the OVS and Linuxbridge driver is set to False.

Change-Id: I0a6994b9248e878e314661f235ceadb7ce9bbbff

commit_message:
Make OVS and LinuxBridge trunk drivers' is_loaded() property more robust

If ML2 is not in use, CONF.ml2.mechanism_drivers is not a registered
option and thus loading these drivers leads to a NoSuchOptError error.
This patch ensures that the exception is handled and the loading state
of the OVS and Linuxbridge driver is set to False.

Partial-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: I0a6994b9248e878e314661f235ceadb7ce9bbbff

User can use this property to configure the timeout value that

Change-Id: If1a46748ee8ccd0159e0c517e9d4eb5d2d17349d
"}]
commit_message:
Make lb timeout configurable

This patch adds a new property 'lb_status_timeout' for lb policy.
User can use this property to configure the timeout value that
senlin waits for loadbalancer to be ready before or after requests
to lbaas V2 service for lb operations.

Change-Id: If1a46748ee8ccd0159e0c517e9d4eb5d2d17349d

subject: Update image volume cache configuration guide
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-24 03:23:57.000000000', 'files': ['doc/admin-guide/source/blockstorage-image-volume-cache.rst'], 'message': 'Update image volume cache configuration guide

When Use other storage backend, such as Ceph, the
image_volume_cache_enabled should be config in bachend
storage configuration section.
For example in Ceph backend storage, in cinder.conf
we shoud add the following confiugration:

[ceph]
image_volume_cache_enabled=True

The reference is
https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/73ea51be6434e86209b0cbc46d1fc2bd64c1dbae/cinder/volume/manager.py#L243

Change-Id: Ia28355d578ada38af324ef3c4b4b14e3aa9adfaa
'}]
commit_message:
Update image volume cache configuration guide

When Use other storage backend, such as Ceph, the
image_volume_cache_enabled should be config in bachend
storage configuration section.
For example in Ceph backend storage, in cinder.conf
we shoud add the following confiugration:

[ceph]
image_volume_cache_enabled=True

The reference is
https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/73ea51be6434e86209b0cbc46d1fc2bd64c1dbae/cinder/volume/manager.py#L243

Change-Id: Ia28355d578ada38af324ef3c4b4b14e3aa9adfaa

subject: Add --incremental flag to backup-create
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-25 05:31:48.000000000', 'files': ['troveclient/tests/test_v1_shell.py', 'troveclient/v1/shell.py', 'releasenotes/notes/incremental_backup-c18804d6277adf62.yaml', 'troveclient/tests/test_backups.py', 'troveclient/v1/backups.py'], 'message': 'Add --incremental flag to backup-create

Added --incremental flag to backup-create and set the default
value to False. When the flag is passed it will create a
backup based on the last good known full/incremental backup.
If there is no previous backup a full backup will be created.

Change-Id: I96498180890b8b1692b1bac3b19988532f6eb077
Partial-Bug: #1607429
'}]
commit_message:
Add --incremental flag to backup-create

Added --incremental flag to backup-create and set the default
value to False. When the flag is passed it will create a
backup based on the last good known full/incremental backup.
If there is no previous backup a full backup will be created.

Change-Id: I96498180890b8b1692b1bac3b19988532f6eb077
Partial-Bug: #1607429

commit_message:

they stabilize).

subject: remove vitrage-release tag rights for vitrage repos
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-24 15:33:05.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/vitrage-dashboard.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/vitrage.config'], 'message': 'remove vitrage-release tag rights for vitrage repos

As a big tent project with a cycle-based release model, vitrage tags
should be applied by the release team. Remove the vitrage-release group
ACLs and rely on the default setting.

Change-Id: I0de8b565fde23bd2065b9d28dd92b8dbae256f7a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove vitrage-release tag rights for vitrage repos

As a big tent project with a cycle-based release model, vitrage tags
should be applied by the release team. Remove the vitrage-release group
ACLs and rely on the default setting.

Change-Id: I0de8b565fde23bd2065b9d28dd92b8dbae256f7a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-23 21:42:35.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Switch ironic-multinode job to wholedisk agent_ssh

Ironic with multitenancy doesn't support partition images as they
require access to image storage during instance boot to get kernel
and ramdisk.
This patch update multinode configuration to use the same agent
and image type as it is used at ironic-multitenancy job.

Change-Id: I547f5772521b5881acad1c37af289797726dc40e
"}]
commit_message:
Switch ironic-multinode job to wholedisk agent_ssh

Ironic with multitenancy doesn't support partition images as they
require access to image storage during instance boot to get kernel
and ramdisk.
This patch update multinode configuration to use the same agent
and image type as it is used at ironic-multitenancy job.

Change-Id: I547f5772521b5881acad1c37af289797726dc40e

commit_message:
Bypassing NodeInfo.acquire_lock() to try OOL

This patch is a test-only hack for the trial purpose.  It bypasses the
NodeInfo.acquire_lock() mechanism to try Optimistic Offline Locking
thru the NodeInfo.version_id&NodeInfo.state attributes.

Change-Id: Ib34f1e86570bd8005054c969cc29ecdc0fc6bb7e

commit_message:
Reorganize receivers directory

This patch reorganizes receivers directory: the base
receiver class is now located in receivers/base.py
while Webhook receiver module is located in
receivers/webhook.py. More types of receiver modules
(e.g. message based receiver) will be located in
receivers/ directory as well.

Partial-bp: message-based-receiver
Change-Id: I8078da26af30611588dcd5cffe0886a414692881

subject: update ovs agent code to catchup neutron's changes.
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-18 23:34:02.000000000', 'files': ['networking_sfc/services/sfc/agent/agent.py'], 'message': "update ovs agent code to catchup neutron's changes.

  - We found neutron has updated its ovs agent code that
    after it calls treat_ports_updated_or_added, it would
    remove all flows on each network port. In this case,
    when there is some port chains, some flow rules for these
    port chains will be cleaned. This change is to move
    adding port chain flow rules in startup stage from
    treat_ports_updated_or_added to _bind_devices. This change
    will fix the issue described above.

Change-Id: Id730976625d60bed9d9d652b23b509cc83bc4122
"}]
commit_message:
update ovs agent code to catchup neutron's changes.

  - We found neutron has updated its ovs agent code that
    after it calls treat_ports_updated_or_added, it would
    remove all flows on each network port. In this case,
    when there is some port chains, some flow rules for these
    port chains will be cleaned. This change is to move
    adding port chain flow rules in startup stage from
    treat_ports_updated_or_added to _bind_devices. This change
    will fix the issue described above.

Change-Id: Id730976625d60bed9d9d652b23b509cc83bc4122

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-25 06:43:35.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'message': 'Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: I52c5d6dbb856b83af6f29b56590b0a98dd621f03
'}]
commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: I52c5d6dbb856b83af6f29b56590b0a98dd621f03

subject: Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-19 01:18:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) 
or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: If74f0884b0bf2467dfc73ffec761ad6d9fa526f5
'}]
commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) 
or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: If74f0884b0bf2467dfc73ffec761ad6d9fa526f5

subject: py3:Remove six.iteritems/iterkeys
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-19 11:34:02.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/api/common/util.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/common/base.py', 'senlin/common/exception.py', 'senlin/engine/registry.py', 'senlin/db/sqlalchemy/utils.py', 'senlin/common/schema.py', 'senlin/drivers/openstack/nova_v2.py', 'senlin/api/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'py3:Remove six.iteritems/iterkeys

1、As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items
2、In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I95e3835c35ac5276233e9dc0ee0e6a73b844e687
'}]
commit_message:
py3:Remove six.iteritems/iterkeys

1、As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items
2、In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I95e3835c35ac5276233e9dc0ee0e6a73b844e687

subject: Fix SoftwareDeployment when dealing with deleted configs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-24 23:53:16.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/software_deployment.py'], 'message': "Fix SoftwareDeployment when dealing with deleted configs

When a SoftwareConfig has been updated, we can't rely on the previous
one not having been deleted because TripleO has a habit of putting all
their SoftwareConfigs inside a nested stack, breaking the UpdateReplace
workflow by splitting the dependency graph.

Instead, load the previous derived config from the Software Deployment
itself.

Change-Id: I9a399a676836be3106268c3640c5edb0c6d8472c
Closes-Bug: #1616550
Related-Bug: #1595040
"}]
commit_message:
Fix SoftwareDeployment when dealing with deleted configs

When a SoftwareConfig has been updated, we can't rely on the previous
one not having been deleted because TripleO has a habit of putting all
their SoftwareConfigs inside a nested stack, breaking the UpdateReplace
workflow by splitting the dependency graph.

Instead, load the previous derived config from the Software Deployment
itself.

Change-Id: I9a399a676836be3106268c3640c5edb0c6d8472c
Closes-Bug: #1616550
Related-Bug: #1595040

commit_message:
Add support for module ordering on apply

Client side of being able to specify 'priority' modules plus a
way to rank the order in which modules are applied.  Two new
attributes 'priority_apply' and 'apply_order' have been added
to the python API and are supported in the CLI by means of the
module-create and module-update commands.

Partially Implements: blueprint module-management-ordering

Change-Id: I2b871c7d1eab634174396bd0905329f3a66755f6

commit_message:
Implemented support for graph metadata

Added support for node filters and node_transitions.
If one of node_transitions status is not specified,
the default will be used, where default is:
- on success:  switch node to status ready
- on error: switch node to status error
- on stop: swith node to status stopped

Change-Id: I8b4d49dc1bada2479017697bf5858e85958579f2
Blueprint: graph-concept-extension
(cherry picked from commit 06d13960594b9d51ed69ba9be45b712cc37ed4c3)

commit_message:
Cap openstack-doc-tools to < 1.0.0

Version 1.0.0 will remove DocBook XML
support for Newton. All Newton repositories are ready for that but for
older branches, let's cap the version for those repos that do not use
constraints yet.

commit_message:
JSON schema get_schema implementation for more complex fields

This implements the get_schema() method of the following FieldType
classes:
UUID, MACAddress, PCIAddress, DateTime, IPV4Address, IPV6Address,
IPV4Network, IPV6Network, Dict

commit_message:
Set OCF_FUNCTIONS_DIR to default value

Otherwise an error is printed into lrmd.log on each script invokation,
see the referenced bug for details. The correct OCF_FUNCTIONS_DIR
setup is taken from the original RabbitMQ OCF script.

Closes-Bug: #1616161

Enable Fuxi to support cluster mode

Destination:
     Enable Fuxi to support cluster mode
Result:
     Create a volume in one node, then other's fuxi-nodes could search it,
     and use it directly while needn't create it again

Change-Id: If4e8745eae4f80ad9d5d7c961caef594e6b94c97

commit_message:
Remove base_distro type 'fedora'

Remove the distribution type 'fedora' from base_distro since it is not
maintained; also, there is no gate for fedora.

Change-Id: Ib937e6819602a1ea20ac4e2c88e09094ae0bfe0c
Closes-bug: #1616387

commit_message:
Remove conversion from dict to object from xenapi live_migration

Since mitaka checks before live-migration operates migrate_data objects
not dicts. This patch removes check and conversion from
check_can_live_migrate_source.

Change-Id: Ic1959c5e733014f2e9c16c3c5d270142ac8a966d

commit_message:
Move resource registry override to enable-tls.yaml

It makes more sense for the enable-tls.yaml file to contain the
resource registry override, since it contains parameters that are
actually used there. Also, this allows us to reuse the
tls-endpoints-public-* files for other methods of enabling TLS (such
as with certmonger).

Change-Id: I98c63d0007e61968c0490a474eddb42548891fa6

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6577, 'name': 'Sergey Kraynev', 'email': 'sergejyit@gmail.com', 'username': 'skraynev'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 8289, 'name': 'huangtianhua', 'email': 'tiantian223@163.com', 'username': 'huangtianhua'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 13009, 'name': 'Peter Razumovsky', 'email': 'prazumovsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'prazumovsky'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 33, 'created': '2016-08-25 01:13:28.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/template.py', 'heat/engine/function.py'], 'message': "Add a Macro class to heat.engine.function

A Macro differs from a function in that it modifies the syntax tree
directly, so that the result of inserting a macro in the tree might not be
just different output, but actually be based on resolving different
functions. A macro can remove syntax from the tree, modify it or fabricate
it from whole cloth prior to parsing.

The proposed If 'function' for implementing conditionals is a macro.
Arguably the Repeat function should be implemented as a macro also.

Change-Id: I2c5afe31d509ffedc9e0b2ef237f52d04687e0be
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-conditions-function
"}]
commit_message:
Add a Macro class to heat.engine.function

A Macro differs from a function in that it modifies the syntax tree
directly, so that the result of inserting a macro in the tree might not be
just different output, but actually be based on resolving different
functions. A macro can remove syntax from the tree, modify it or fabricate
it from whole cloth prior to parsing.

The proposed If 'function' for implementing conditionals is a macro.
Arguably the Repeat function should be implemented as a macro also.

Change-Id: I2c5afe31d509ffedc9e0b2ef237f52d04687e0be
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-conditions-function

subject: Cap openstack-doc-tools to < 1.0.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-23 04:21:38.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Cap openstack-doc-tools to < 1.0.0

Version 1.0.0 will remove DocBook XML support for Newton. All Newton
repositories are ready for that but for older branches, let's cap the
version for those repos that do not use constraints yet.

Change-Id: I0a4e70757b13c91d59d824d2d2e11b7ab45e3cab
"}]
commit_message:
Cap openstack-doc-tools to < 1.0.0

Version 1.0.0 will remove DocBook XML support for Newton. All Newton
repositories are ready for that but for older branches, let's cap the
version for those repos that do not use constraints yet.

commit_message:
Support condition for output

Provides output condition for cfn/hot templates,
if the condition of output evaluates to false, will
set output value to None.

Change-Id: I0398e39541a4176ef5699331c10536c59f1cb3e7
Blueprint: support-conditions-function

subject: More sophisticated logging on privileged side
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 5997, 'name': 'Walt', 'display_name': 'Hemna', 'email': 'waboring@hemna.com', 'username': 'walter-boring', 'status': 'SAP'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8688, 'name': 'Alexis Lee', 'email': 'openstack@lxsli.co.uk', 'username': 'lxsli'}, {'_account_id': 11279, 'name': 'Angus Lees', 'email': 'gus@inodes.org', 'username': 'gus'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-03 23:56:08.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_privsep/daemon.py', 'oslo_privsep/tests/test_daemon.py', 'oslo_privsep/comm.py'], 'message': 'More sophisticated logging on privileged side

Any python logging messages generated on the privileged side (that
exceed the python logging level) are sent to the unprivileged side,
where the actual write to the regular oslo.log logger occurs.

Before, those priv->unpriv logging messages were dumb lines written to
stderr.  This meant the original severity level was lost, and the unpriv
side made the arbitrary/conservative choice to always log them at WARNING.

With this change, those priv->unpriv logging messages are sent down the
regular priv<->unpriv communication channel using a new "out of band"
mechanism.  The messages now include the original severity level, which
the unpriv side now honours.  And there was much rejoicing.

Any lines that *do* end up on stderr (using the exec method) will
continue to be logged at WARNING, since these will most likely be
"privsep-helper command not found" or similarly important.

Change-Id: Ifc63aedbec4ababefd2138cb73b348e2698db4ad
Closes-Bug: #1593743
'}]
commit_message:
More sophisticated logging on privileged side

Any python logging messages generated on the privileged side (that
exceed the python logging level) are sent to the unprivileged side,
where the actual write to the regular oslo.log logger occurs.

Before, those priv->unpriv logging messages were dumb lines written to
stderr.  This meant the original severity level was lost, and the unpriv
side made the arbitrary/conservative choice to always log them at WARNING.

With this change, those priv->unpriv logging messages are sent down the
regular priv<->unpriv communication channel using a new "out of band"
mechanism.  The messages now include the original severity level, which
the unpriv side now honours.  And there was much rejoicing.

Any lines that *do* end up on stderr (using the exec method) will
continue to be logged at WARNING, since these will most likely be
"privsep-helper command not found" or similarly important.

Change-Id: Ifc63aedbec4ababefd2138cb73b348e2698db4ad
Closes-Bug: #1593743

commit_message:
Make InstanceGroup object favor the API database

This makes the InstanceGroup object load first from the API database,
falling back to the main database as necessary. Creates happen in the
API database only now.

Part of blueprint cells-instance-groups-api-db

Change-Id: I2fe7524818e92a4d9a55f84633e70091a42531ea

There are two complementary Neutron DHCP agent params:
    - enable_isolated_metadata
    - enable_metadata_network
to configure metadata service for new VMs. This change add support for
'enable_metadata_network' paramater which was missing so far.

Change-Id: I251b6a2b331f51d1ae062fa13673bdef01c1ef12
"}]
commit_message:
Add NeutronEnableMetadataNetwork to composable neutron dhcp service

There are two complementary Neutron DHCP agent params:
    - enable_isolated_metadata
    - enable_metadata_network
to configure metadata service for new VMs. This change add support for
'enable_metadata_network' paramater which was missing so far.

Change-Id: I251b6a2b331f51d1ae062fa13673bdef01c1ef12

This patch makes Nova:

Closes-Bug: #1582045

commit_message:
Support Identity v3 when connecting to Ironic

This patch makes Nova:
a) support Identity v3 params when creating an Ironiccient by
creating a v3Password auth plugin and a Session;
b) deprecate auth parameters admin_tenant_name, admin_username
admin_password and admin_url;
c) remove support to admin_auth_token auth parameter [1].

[1] admin_auth_token was deprecated
(317d9d8f13e8a34af189504ae1258d315154cc82) in favour of admin_username and
admin_password (which are deprecated now in favour of username and
password). More info at Keystone release notes (see Deprecation Notes
and Security Issues):
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystone/mitaka.html#deprecation-notes

Change-Id: Id837d26bb21c158de0504627e488c0692aef1e24
Closes-Bug: #1582045

subject: Run 'ip netns list' according to 'AGENT/use_helper_for_ns_read'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-05 07:55:35.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py'], 'message': "Run 'ip netns list' according to 'AGENT/use_helper_for_ns_read'

In some OSes, e.g. CentOS 7, `ip netns list` returns empty if not
executed by root. 'AGENT/use_helper_for_ns_read' was added to use
rootwraper for these platforms. IPWrapper.get_namespaces missed
the parameter as a result of commit
339a1ccbb931ff906143ee6339376836f6f4563e

Change-Id: I0d2000448c940e1ddb328f73bce33dcb06406ee1
"}]
commit_message:
Run 'ip netns list' according to 'AGENT/use_helper_for_ns_read'

In some OSes, e.g. CentOS 7, `ip netns list` returns empty if not
executed by root. 'AGENT/use_helper_for_ns_read' was added to use
rootwraper for these platforms. IPWrapper.get_namespaces missed
the parameter as a result of commit
339a1ccbb931ff906143ee6339376836f6f4563e

Change-Id: I0d2000448c940e1ddb328f73bce33dcb06406ee1

subject: Make identity v3 credentials_client use **kwargs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-03 00:26:28.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/identity/v3/json/credentials_client.py'], 'message': 'Make identity v3 credentials_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

This patch makes identity v3 credentials_client list API accept
filter param.

Also add and correct doc string link.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I7e1aed5cab5a120b955a12070535e6d4a97b9f3e
'}]
commit_message:
Make identity v3 credentials_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

This patch makes identity v3 credentials_client list API accept
filter param.

Also add and correct doc string link.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I7e1aed5cab5a120b955a12070535e6d4a97b9f3e

subject: Only restart apache if the apache config changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-25 04:55:17.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/server-apache.rb', 'spec/server-apache_spec.rb', 'resources/service.rb', 'libraries/matchers.rb', 'providers/service.rb'], 'message': 'Only restart apache if the apache config changes

  The server-apache recipe had been restarting apache on every run.

  The consequence of this was that clients may not have been able to connect
  momentarily and active connections may have been dropped during chef client
  runs.

  Change-Id: I263d733c007b2d5be91198505b0c6257b4d66988
  Closes-Bug: #1614312

Change-Id: If54eeca3dfc1de0553d76328837021858e3c619d
'}]
commit_message:
Only restart apache if the apache config changes

  The server-apache recipe had been restarting apache on every run.

  The consequence of this was that clients may not have been able to connect
  momentarily and active connections may have been dropped during chef client
  runs.

  Change-Id: I263d733c007b2d5be91198505b0c6257b4d66988
  Closes-Bug: #1614312

Change-Id: If54eeca3dfc1de0553d76328837021858e3c619d

commit_message:
Include [agent] extensions option into ovs/linuxbridge agent files

The option was introduced in Liberty. In Mitaka, we switched to using
oslo-config-generator but missed including this specific option.

The patch returns the option back. It should be backported to Mitaka.

Change-Id: Ie4a4ea44eedac3d6c7ac1b6e0739f6c44212b2ea
Closes-Bug: #1602358

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-25 01:22:02.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/tests/unit/v2/cli/test_deployment_graph.py', 'fuelclient/client.py', 'fuelclient/v1/graph.py', 'fuelclient/commands/graph.py'], 'message': "Now it is possilble to upload deployment graph via CLI

Also fixed fail in case if post request returns 204
also supported upload from directory.
the target dir should contain files: metadata.yaml and tasks.yaml

$ fuel2 graph upload --env 1 --file new_graph.yaml
$ fuel2 graph upload --release 1 --dir /var/data/graphs/provision -t provision

Now accepting two structure formats wrapped into the YAML:
1. {'tasks': [], 'metadata': {}, ....}
2. [{id: 'task1', ...}, {id: 'task2', ...}]

Change-Id: I5b5fc8c2733d0bc6bc31fb3a9e3d632b6e429ce7
Closes-Bug: #1615849
"}]
commit_message:
Now it is possilble to upload deployment graph via CLI

Also fixed fail in case if post request returns 204
also supported upload from directory.
the target dir should contain files: metadata.yaml and tasks.yaml

$ fuel2 graph upload --env 1 --file new_graph.yaml
$ fuel2 graph upload --release 1 --dir /var/data/graphs/provision -t provision

Now accepting two structure formats wrapped into the YAML:
1. {'tasks': [], 'metadata': {}, ....}
2. [{id: 'task1', ...}, {id: 'task2', ...}]

Change-Id: I5b5fc8c2733d0bc6bc31fb3a9e3d632b6e429ce7
Closes-Bug: #1615849

commit_message:
Strip leading/trailing whitespace from headers

New versions of requests will raise an InvalidHeader error otherwise.

subject: Use Newton releases for glanceclient
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-24 03:06:49.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Use Newton releases for glanceclient

Currently, g-r is allowing mitaka releases of glanceclient too. To
ensure consistency and up to date use of client it's best to bump to
Newton releases before we cut stable.

g-r has been updated to use a reasonable release value for newton
releases -- neither too permissive nor too conservative in allowing
only few. This will give packagers some breathing room as well as cover
decent amount of bug fixes.

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/releases/tree/deliverables/newton/python-glanceclient.yaml

Change-Id: I00496ef56e94f4159b2177ed94d7bab8e3d4a7e7
"}]
commit_message:
Use Newton releases for glanceclient

Currently, g-r is allowing mitaka releases of glanceclient too. To
ensure consistency and up to date use of client it's best to bump to
Newton releases before we cut stable.

g-r has been updated to use a reasonable release value for newton
releases -- neither too permissive nor too conservative in allowing
only few. This will give packagers some breathing room as well as cover
decent amount of bug fixes.

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/releases/tree/deliverables/newton/python-glanceclient.yaml

Change-Id: I00496ef56e94f4159b2177ed94d7bab8e3d4a7e7

subject: Improve readability in the obj server's unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-24 02:12:19.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_server.py'], 'message': "Improve readability in the obj server's unit tests

This change improves the readability of the object-server's unit
tests by breaking down some long assertTrue statements into smaller
and much easier to read and more relevant assert statements.

For example:
    assertTrue(a in resp.headers and
               b in resp.headers and
               c not in resp.headers)

Is equal to:
    assertIn(a, resp.headers)
    assertIn(b, resp.headers)
    assertNotIn(c, resp.headers)

Change-Id: Iba746ecfb1a1dc541856b7a4c9d2f00d08e4ad51
"}]
commit_message:
Improve readability in the obj server's unit tests

This change improves the readability of the object-server's unit
tests by breaking down some long assertTrue statements into smaller
and much easier to read and more relevant assert statements.

For example:
    assertTrue(a in resp.headers and
               b in resp.headers and
               c not in resp.headers)

Is equal to:
    assertIn(a, resp.headers)
    assertIn(b, resp.headers)
    assertNotIn(c, resp.headers)

Change-Id: Iba746ecfb1a1dc541856b7a4c9d2f00d08e4ad51

subject: hz-field-directive handle no value property
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-24 14:57:34.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/framework/widgets/property/hz-field.directive.js'], 'message': "hz-field-directive handle no value property

hz-field-directive was developed using hz images panel where every
single property had at least the no value filter applied. However,
when using it with properties that don't have the no value filter
applied and there is no value, we'll see the following in console.log

angular.js:12783 TypeError: Cannot read property 'then' of undefined

Change-Id: I14f8d56cc9086e7e25e11c081de34bc9d21389d0
Closes-Bug: #1614630
"}]
commit_message:
hz-field-directive handle no value property

hz-field-directive was developed using hz images panel where every
single property had at least the no value filter applied. However,
when using it with properties that don't have the no value filter
applied and there is no value, we'll see the following in console.log

angular.js:12783 TypeError: Cannot read property 'then' of undefined

Change-Id: I14f8d56cc9086e7e25e11c081de34bc9d21389d0
Closes-Bug: #1614630

commit_message:
Move provision tasks out of nailgun and astute

Provision and deletion tasks shouldn't be hardcoded into nailgun and
astute. This patch creates representation for these tasks in library
side as a separate graphs which can be executed in consecutive manner.

blueprint: graph-concept-extension

Change-Id: Icb55739ad1dbffa3c32341b1caea9046d7917240

commit_message:
Use method Node.get_status to get status of node

Because error status derived from error_type the correct
way to detect that node in error state is using method
Node.get_status

Change-Id: Ide8810ab207ef37fd1b6b80e8b2eeb99e8c50d22
Blueprint: graph-concept-extension

commit_message:
Add 'openstack baremetal node adopt' command

This extends the OpenStackClient plugin with the new command
'openstack baremetal node adopt'. The command sets a node's
provision state to 'adopt'.

Change-Id: Ib41e1c66378df7db2e5396b940930a9f7e009977
Partial-Bug: 1526479

commit_message:
Now /graphs/execute/ handler is used to execute graph

$ fuel2 graph execute --env 1 [--nodes 1 2 3] [--graph_types gtype1 gtype2] [--task-names task1 task2] [--force] [--dry-run]
now calling brand new:
/api/v1/graphs/execute/
handler that using the Transactions Manager.

Also now it is possible to call:

$ fuel2 graph execute --force
to enforce execution of tasks without skipping.

$ fuel2 graph execute --task-names task1 task2
to run only specific tasks ignoring dependancies.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Iafc59c60a1ebce4a360ce1faa00a27ab320fa90b
Implements: blueprint graph-concept-extension
(cherry picked from commit 98e45a0317a1482e6ac1e3b5950c741f3432775a)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 16:01:28.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Update Kuryr mission statement

Kuryr currently bridge between containers networking models
(Like Kubernetes/Docker and others) to Neutron and OpenStack
Networking advance services.

When one think about this model, storage and backup areas
in Openstack are pretty mature and flexible to enhance containers
in terms of storage and volume sharing/re-cycling and more.
(Not to mention backups which there are already few projects in
OpenStack in that area)

Our team agreed that Kuryr seems the natural place to expand
our concept to storage just as we do right now for networking.
Its important to note that this doesnt overlap with any OpenStack
project that we currently know of.

Change-Id: Ie94dcd581ab004b38d1112d784df8f527dea5f10
'}]
commit_message:
Update Kuryr mission statement

Kuryr currently bridge between containers networking models
(Like Kubernetes/Docker and others) to Neutron and OpenStack
Networking advance services.

When one think about this model, storage and backup areas
in Openstack are pretty mature and flexible to enhance containers
in terms of storage and volume sharing/re-cycling and more.
(Not to mention backups which there are already few projects in
OpenStack in that area)

Our team agreed that Kuryr seems the natural place to expand
our concept to storage just as we do right now for networking.
Its important to note that this doesnt overlap with any OpenStack
project that we currently know of.

Change-Id: Ie94dcd581ab004b38d1112d784df8f527dea5f10

commit_message:
Limit LXC hosts playbook to container hosts only

This will limit the lxc-hosts-setup playbook to run against only
the hosts which will receive LXC containers. This prevents LXC
package installation and cache preparation on hosts such as
compute_hosts which will not build any containers.

Manual cherry-pick of I002158d6539603ddb86d4b7ea1e4a16bb4ced81f

Change-Id: I14df580263ee667d5a2fc26235313461b30eda1e

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-08 16:13:30.000000000', 'files': ['network/config/single-nic-linux-bridge-vlans/swift-storage.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-vlans/controller.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-vlans/swift-storage.yaml', 'network/config/multiple-nics/swift-storage.yaml', 'network/config/bond-with-vlans/ceph-storage.yaml', 'network/config/bond-with-vlans/controller-no-external.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-linux-bridge-vlans/compute.yaml', 'network/config/multiple-nics/controller-v6.yaml', 'network/config/multiple-nics/ceph-storage.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-linux-bridge-vlans/controller-v6.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-linux-bridge-vlans/controller.yaml', 'network/config/multiple-nics/compute.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-vlans/ceph-storage.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-vlans/controller-no-external.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-linux-bridge-vlans/cinder-storage.yaml', 'network/config/bond-with-vlans/controller-v6.yaml', 'environments/network-environment.yaml', 'network/config/bond-with-vlans/cinder-storage.yaml', 'network/config/bond-with-vlans/compute.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-vlans/cinder-storage.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-vlans/compute.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-linux-bridge-vlans/ceph-storage.yaml', 'network/config/bond-with-vlans/swift-storage.yaml', 'network/config/multiple-nics/cinder-storage.yaml', 'network/config/bond-with-vlans/controller.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-vlans/controller-v6.yaml', 'network/config/multiple-nics/controller.yaml'], 'message': 'Updates and fixes to NIC config template routes

This change adds the ManagementInterfaceDefaultRoute parameter
for setting the Management network as the default route in some
deployments. Notes were added to indicate that if the Management
network is used as the default gateway, then the default route
on the control plane should be commented out.

The sample network-environment.yaml was modified to include the
ManagementInterfaceDefaultRoute, but this is commented out like
the rest of the Management network parameters.

This change also adds the ControlPlaneDefaultRoute and
ExternalInterfaceDefaultRoute to all templates, so that if the
networks are customized, the NIC configs can be modified without
having to modify the parameters section of the template. The
default for the ExternalInterfaceDefaultRoute is '10.0.0.1', and
the default for ManagementInterfaceDefaultRoute is set to 'unset'.

This change also converts the single-nic-linux-bridge-vlans from
DHCP to static IPs on the Control Plane Interface, bringing these
templates in line with the rest of the NIC config templates. The
parameters needed to be updated in these templates as well.

The controller-v6.yaml templates had a default value of "10.0.0.1"
for the ExternalInterfaceDefaultRoute. This was confusing, and is
now undefined.

This change also sets a default gateway on the Control Plane in
controller-no-external.yaml templates.

Change-Id: I8ea6733fe46902e1baeff4ccfbcd42ecc5a1825f
'}]
commit_message:
Updates and fixes to NIC config template routes

This change adds the ManagementInterfaceDefaultRoute parameter
for setting the Management network as the default route in some
deployments. Notes were added to indicate that if the Management
network is used as the default gateway, then the default route
on the control plane should be commented out.

The sample network-environment.yaml was modified to include the
ManagementInterfaceDefaultRoute, but this is commented out like
the rest of the Management network parameters.

This change also adds the ControlPlaneDefaultRoute and
ExternalInterfaceDefaultRoute to all templates, so that if the
networks are customized, the NIC configs can be modified without
having to modify the parameters section of the template. The
default for the ExternalInterfaceDefaultRoute is '10.0.0.1', and
the default for ManagementInterfaceDefaultRoute is set to 'unset'.

This change also converts the single-nic-linux-bridge-vlans from
DHCP to static IPs on the Control Plane Interface, bringing these
templates in line with the rest of the NIC config templates. The
parameters needed to be updated in these templates as well.

The controller-v6.yaml templates had a default value of "10.0.0.1"
for the ExternalInterfaceDefaultRoute. This was confusing, and is
now undefined.

This change also sets a default gateway on the Control Plane in
controller-no-external.yaml templates.

Change-Id: I8ea6733fe46902e1baeff4ccfbcd42ecc5a1825f

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-31 06:59:31.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/framework/util/filters/filters.spec.js', 'horizon/static/framework/util/filters/filters.js'], 'message': 'A yesno filter should consider string

For instance, a bootable item in cinder volume
can be "true" or "false".

There is a possibility of same case in other item.

By all rights, we should change the type
from string to boolean.
However, It would be better for us to consider
a string data type in yesno filter.

Closes-Bug: #1587263
Change-Id: I52c4f4e821ec974ad99e8e2459593845d6206a02
'}]
commit_message:
A yesno filter should consider string

For instance, a bootable item in cinder volume
can be "true" or "false".

There is a possibility of same case in other item.

By all rights, we should change the type
from string to boolean.
However, It would be better for us to consider
a string data type in yesno filter.

Closes-Bug: #1587263
Change-Id: I52c4f4e821ec974ad99e8e2459593845d6206a02

commit_message:
Don't pass value_specs when creating internal port

When we create the internal port on a nova server, we shouldn't pass
value_specs when specifying extra properties, as it's an internal
dictionary which is not accepted by the API.

Change-Id: I0bb4407e89b5575dbaf8f198402e0926b550224d
Closes-Bug: #1607364
(cherry picked from commit 2245aa117e8fae5710244ab1182b499aba82b339)

subject: py3:Rmove six.iteritems/iterkeys in python-senlinclient
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-24 06:12:49.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/v1/cluster.py', 'senlinclient/v1/event.py', 'senlinclient/v1/receiver.py', 'senlinclient/tests/unit/v1/fakes.py', 'senlinclient/v1/profile_type.py', 'senlinclient/v1/cluster_policy.py', 'senlinclient/v1/policy_type.py', 'senlinclient/v1/action.py', 'senlinclient/v1/node.py'], 'message': 'py3:Rmove six.iteritems/iterkeys in python-senlinclient

1、As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems/keys achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items/keys instead, as it will return iterators in
PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2、In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I75d12f56821666ebaec8350acba3a5fc29957f1e
'}]
commit_message:
py3:Rmove six.iteritems/iterkeys in python-senlinclient

1、As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems/keys achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items/keys instead, as it will return iterators in
PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2、In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I75d12f56821666ebaec8350acba3a5fc29957f1e

subject: Skip post-config based on t-h-t flag
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-10 09:25:49.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': 'Skip post-config based on t-h-t flag

If the ManagedEndpoints flag comes from t-h-t as an output, then we
can assert that the keystone services and endpoints are managed by
puppet, and thus we can skip the post-config step.

Change-Id: Ibbbe1e016e7e47ea5577de33c5a11d4088811616
'}]
commit_message:
Skip post-config based on t-h-t flag

If the ManagedEndpoints flag comes from t-h-t as an output, then we
can assert that the keystone services and endpoints are managed by
puppet, and thus we can skip the post-config step.

Change-Id: Ibbbe1e016e7e47ea5577de33c5a11d4088811616

Add spec for active-active

This specification contains a high-level description of a proposed
architecture for handling an active-active topology within Octavia.

Moved Distributor to new document.
Captured the comments from Mitaka mid-cycle.

Updated active-active-topology per latest comments.

Major update to active-active-distributor per latest comments.

More updates per comments

commit_message:
Allow a fixed IP to be allocated to RedisVirtualIP

The overcloud stack now contains a parameter RedisVirtualFixedIPs which will
allow people to specify the IP address they would like to be assigned as a vip
used by Redis. This will allow people full control over what IPs are used as
VIPs during a deployment.

Change-Id: Ib24e62847c4ac43fcd2a09bc84b4a76e992add4b

commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown,
it should call 'raise' without any arguments
because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where
the exception re-raised

Change-Id: I875d159c0c229c9637b9d95c1a91c4651daafc44

commit_message:
Remove LVM config from openstack_hosts

The LVM configuration tasks/template are no longer needed in the
openstack_hosts role since they're already in the os_cinder role.
This patch removes the tasks and the lvm.conf template.

Partial-bug: 1615325
Change-Id: I09b2cd9a1eee9f8310783b7d6468963b21fee322

commit_message:
Nuke lbaas v1

v1 is not going to ship in Newton, the deprecation notice
been around for two cycles, and there is now a migration
script.

Also includes: Fix alembic migration env

The include_object() checking was missing, and also the inclusion
of all lbaas DB models

Co-Authored-By: Henry Gessau <gessau@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I506949e75bc62681412358ba689cb07b16311b68

subject: Revert "[trove] Promote scenario tests to voting and gating"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-15 09:56:39.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "[trove] Promote scenario tests to voting and gating"

This reverts commit f6ca83d972291a7dcb1762469dabc8e4d43a2f81.

With increased load on the CI system as we approach the N deadline,
the two jobs which were made voting are taking increasingly longer,
and are often timing out. A lot of work had been done early in the
cycle to streamline the jobs and we felt that this would have been
enough. But, given the number of failures, and the coming release
crunch, it may be time to make them non-voting again till we can
figure out how to improve them.

Change-Id: Ib512a2a0b00852b7c77e5326437f7f4b0dd5bc4f
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "[trove] Promote scenario tests to voting and gating"

This reverts commit f6ca83d972291a7dcb1762469dabc8e4d43a2f81.

With increased load on the CI system as we approach the N deadline,
the two jobs which were made voting are taking increasingly longer,
and are often timing out. A lot of work had been done early in the
cycle to streamline the jobs and we felt that this would have been
enough. But, given the number of failures, and the coming release
crunch, it may be time to make them non-voting again till we can
figure out how to improve them.

Change-Id: Ib512a2a0b00852b7c77e5326437f7f4b0dd5bc4f

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-24 21:45:17.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron-legacy'], 'message': 'Accept IPv6 RAs on the interface with the default route

Because neutron sets ipv6 forwarding settings, we stop accepting RAs
from IPv6-only host environments. This leads to a loss of external
connectivity, which is bad for zuul running tests and stuff.

Setting accept_ra to 2 will cause the RAs to be accepted.

(cherry picked from commit 85b1308be4f4107a9054037b1d7351f57f473a1f)

Conflicts:
	lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3

Closes-bug: #1616282

Change-Id: Ia044fff2a1731ab6c04f82aea47096b425e0c0a0
'}]
commit_message:
Accept IPv6 RAs on the interface with the default route

Because neutron sets ipv6 forwarding settings, we stop accepting RAs
from IPv6-only host environments. This leads to a loss of external
connectivity, which is bad for zuul running tests and stuff.

Setting accept_ra to 2 will cause the RAs to be accepted.

(cherry picked from commit 85b1308be4f4107a9054037b1d7351f57f473a1f)

Conflicts:
	lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3

Closes-bug: #1616282

Change-Id: Ia044fff2a1731ab6c04f82aea47096b425e0c0a0

appropriately while being compatible with Barbican as a key
manager.

commit_message:
Check if c-vol is enabled

start_cinder from devstack doesn't always run the c-vol service
as it may be disabled (for example in a multi-node setup). The
log checks, however, were assuming it as always enabled.

Change-Id: Iab6156cc25f78e8f80b220bc93c2b2e4974a585a

commit_message:

Base classes of commands are defined in cliff,
but have been encapsulated again in osc-lib for
all plugin clients. So use osc-lib instead of
cliff.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-19 07:05:51.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'cueclient/osc/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Use osc-lib instead of openstackclient

osc-lib is a package of common support modules for writing
OSC plugins. All common functions, classes such as exceptions,
utils, logs and so on have been moved from openstackclient to
osc-lib.

So use osc-lib instead of openstackclient.

Change-Id: I5907dfdfc92b9d10c8940c12adf0c230650a2c4f
'}]
commit_message:
Use osc-lib instead of openstackclient

osc-lib is a package of common support modules for writing
OSC plugins. All common functions, classes such as exceptions,
utils, logs and so on have been moved from openstackclient to
osc-lib.

So use osc-lib instead of openstackclient.

Change-Id: I5907dfdfc92b9d10c8940c12adf0c230650a2c4f

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-08-24 22:49:29.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_deployment_graph_handlers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/objects/deployment_graph.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/handlers/deployment_graph.py'], 'message': "Now it is possible to filter /api/v1/graphs/ output

following filter parameters are possible:

/api/v1/graphs/?clusters_ids=cluster1,cluster2&fetch_related=1
/api/v1/graphs/?plugins_ids=plugin1
/api/v1/graphs/?releases_ids=release1,release2

/api/v1/graphs/?graph_types=my-graph-type

`fetch_related` option working only for 'cluster' level telling Nailgun to include
all graphs related to plugins enabled for this cluster and tis cluster's release.

Logic of work:
(releases OR plugins OR clusters) AND type

Change-Id: Ib1d6dcd4483451dc71a701beb13805098380e22f
Closes-Bug: #1606931
(cherry picked from commit 9c75a4db71505acb0d5cb100aabdc03699e3f507)
"}]
commit_message:
Now it is possible to filter /api/v1/graphs/ output

following filter parameters are possible:

/api/v1/graphs/?clusters_ids=cluster1,cluster2&fetch_related=1
/api/v1/graphs/?plugins_ids=plugin1
/api/v1/graphs/?releases_ids=release1,release2

/api/v1/graphs/?graph_types=my-graph-type

`fetch_related` option working only for 'cluster' level telling Nailgun to include
all graphs related to plugins enabled for this cluster and tis cluster's release.

Logic of work:
(releases OR plugins OR clusters) AND type

Change-Id: Ib1d6dcd4483451dc71a701beb13805098380e22f
Closes-Bug: #1606931
(cherry picked from commit 9c75a4db71505acb0d5cb100aabdc03699e3f507)

subject: Fixes Neutron metadata parameters in THT
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-24 19:25:36.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/neutron-dhcp.yaml'], 'message': 'Fixes Neutron metadata parameters in THT

Changes include:
 - Adds missing parameter to enable DHCP Metadata networks, which is
   required to enable isolated or forced metadata via DHCP agent
 - Fixes isolated metadata parameter to use a boolean
 - Fixes regression where force metadata parameter was accidentally
   removed

Closes-Bug: 1613743

Change-Id: I08f907fe8a8e89e108351b84db33c4d9c004b957
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Neutron metadata parameters in THT

Changes include:
 - Adds missing parameter to enable DHCP Metadata networks, which is
   required to enable isolated or forced metadata via DHCP agent
 - Fixes isolated metadata parameter to use a boolean
 - Fixes regression where force metadata parameter was accidentally
   removed

Closes-Bug: 1613743

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-12 15:08:13.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_volume_actions.py', 'cinder/image/image_utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/vhd-disk-format-upload-to-image-5851f9d35f4ee447.yaml'], 'message': "Fix volume upload-to-image for vhd disk-format

It was previously assumed that glance did not support qed
disk-format.
qemu-img still uses the legacy 'vpc' format name as a

being passed as a parameter which is invalid.

This fix adds 'vhd' to the valid disk formats and passes
'vpc' to 'qemu-img convert', which is correct use of the

'vhdx' disk format was not included in the cherry pick as

Change-Id: I24e6b78505a2c77b309c79ef11466c08bad1c50a
